founders.name: Topaz Turkenitz, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder & CEO at Vespper. 
I grew up in Australia and have been programming since I was 16 years old. I studied computer science, worked at 99designs (double-sided marketplace) and Snyk (dev-first security product) among other side-quests. I've built everything from an Iphone app, chrome extensions, slack bots, frontend and backend. I'm a jack of all trades that likes to obsessively go all in on a problem.

founders.name: Dudu Lasry, Founder

generated_description:
**Vespper: Your AI On-Call Engineer**

Founded in 2024, Vespper is making waves in the realm of software engineering by reimagining how teams manage production alerts. Operating out of Y Combinator's Batch F24, this tiny but ambitious startup comprises just two former senior engineers from Google, Snyk, and Viz.ai—Topaz and Dudu. They’ve experienced the stress of on-call duties firsthand and decided to create a solution that turns the chaos of tech support into a more manageable process.

### Mission and Product

At its core, Vespper is an AI agent that operates around the clock to troubleshoot production alerts, providing timely insights that reduce downtime and mitigate alert fatigue. This means less frustration for engineers who can focus on high-priority issues while Vespper automates the tedious aspects of incident response. Essentially, Vespper ensures that no alert falls through the cracks, significantly reducing Mean Time to Resolution (MTTR) and preventing engineer burnout.

### Features and Integrations

Vespper boasts impressive capabilities such as:
- Real-time troubleshooting of alerts
- Anomaly detection in metrics
- Log querying for insights
- Assessment of customer impact
- Tracking and resolution history of incidents

It also integrates smoothly with popular tools like DataDog, Grafana, GitHub, and Slack, making life easier for teams by streamlining their workflows.

### The Problem They Solve

Being on-call is often a stressful duty fraught with data overload and unexpected outages. Vespper addresses these pain points by automating many of the tasks that lead to burnout and downtime. Their service is particularly valuable for companies that rely on stringent SLAs and need quick, reliable incident management. 

### Why Vespper Stands Out

What sets Vespper apart is how it’s built—by developers for developers. The founding team knows the struggles of managing alerts under pressure and has indeed created a product that helps teams become more agile and responsive. Additionally, Vespper offers robust security measures, user control over data, and the potential for self-hosting.

### Connect and Learn More

If you're intrigued and want to see Vespper in action, you can book a demo on their [website](https://vespper.com). Moreover, they maintain a vibrant Slack community where you can engage with fellow users and the team. 

In summary, Vespper is not just another AI tool; it’s a thoughtful solution designed to alleviate the burdens faced by software engineers today, and they’re just getting started. Their commitment to reducing chaos in incident management makes them a promising player in the tech landscape.
